sub_title: Infection Preventionist, International Patient Safety Friendly Hospital Accessor, Healthcare Quality Improvement Specialist, Cardiac Catherization Laboratory Specialist Nurse
summary: In January 2020, I completed my MPH degree. I graduated also with a Master's degree in Nursing(MSN) in October 2011 and I completed my Bachelor Science Degree (BSN) in General Nursing in September 1992, and since that time  I have been working in different positions such as, International Assessor of Patient Safety Standards, IPC, Critical Care & Cath Lab Nurse in different organizations, including World Health Organization (WHO), Doctors Without Borders (MSF), Saudi Oil Company (Aramco), UAE Oil Company (ADNOC), and Iran Ministry of Health. I was certified as an IPC Specialist, ATCN, ACLS & PALS provider.

[{'company': {'id': 8142909, 'name': 'Artsen zonder Grenzen Nederland', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQHWLfapguDRzA/company-logo_400_400/0/1685621462699?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=vjnV7iOXqEY3jDnaSjAXb0rkDfvlou4Azhy6Ga1q1DY', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/artsenzondergrenzen/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Artsen zonder Grenzen Nederland', 'description': 'Main duties & responsibilities
•	IPC Virtual Assessments to capture current state of IPC in hospitals and guide the IPC Advisor/Field Team in assessing and implementing key IPC activities
•	Telephone support and follow-up of key IPC activities and concerns from field teams
•	Aggregate analysis of IPC Assessment results so HQ can better understand the key challenges, successes, and meet our field team IPC needs
•	Telemedicine Platform IPC Consults', 'title': 'Infection Preventionist', 'employment_type': 'Contract'}]}, {'company': {'id': 15094438, 'name': 'Urmia University of Medical Sciences', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQFpTN28oKUpww/company-logo_400_400/0/1569826266472?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=hDmb4Ihy6C6GPnk2XYpaxuaF_LHDi6GWVW2ZFyM5ChM', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/urmia-university-of-medical-sciences/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Urmia, West Azerbaijan, Iran', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Urmia University of Medical Sciences', 'description': 'Main duties & responsibilities
•	Participation in the development and regular review of National Accreditation Standards for Iranian Hospitals
•	Senior member of the National Committee that line up National Accreditation Standards for Iranian Hospital with ISQUA requirements.
•	Training of Iranian Hospital Accreditation Standards assessors
•	Senior assessor of Iranian Hospital Accreditation Standards
•	Assessor of WHO Patient Safety Friendly Initiative Standards
•	Lead and communicate ‘best practice’ in clinical risk management & IPC
•	Manage and coordinate the Clinical Review Panel program including identification of cases, preparation of timelines, coordinating presenters, preparation of agendas and ensuring that recommendations are monitored and tracked to completion via the Clinical Outcome Review Committee
•	Liaise with and provide assistance to project coordinators and relevant Committees for Patient Safety, IPC and Clinical Risk Management Projects
•	Liaise with Clinical Service, Unit Directors and other staff to ensure clinical risk management, IPC & Patient Safety principles are integrated into quality improvement 
•	Liaise managers to provide consultation and support for local critical incident review
•	Assist in the preparation and analysis of data for quality, risk management and compliance purposes for key organisational governance committees
•	Assist Vice-Chancellor of Treatment Affairs to meet the National Accreditation Standards and other mandatory compliance requirements by supporting the processes to meet the standards and providing advice and training to staff
•	Support the implementation of quality and safety initiatives led by the MOH and other relevant sources
•	Participate and assist in other projects as required in the delivery of the functions of the Quality, Safety and Risk Management Units', 'title': 'Healthcare Specialist', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 54128163, 'name': 'World Health Organization Somalia ', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGV49gpcRiiRg/company-logo_400_400/0/1591344182085?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=baUEcFZJfu3yCub2c1b9hfED2hC0hit7FdqEZPx393I', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/whosomalia/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Somalia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'World Health Organization Somalia ', 'description': 'Main duties & responsibilities
•	Work in coordination with the outbreak response team to ensure IPC priorities activities are managed effectively within the overall outbreak response in line with WHO IPC guidelines 
•	Assess IPC capacities and practices in hospitals and health care facilities in the area directly affected by the outbreak. Identify needs for further assessment based on this revision 
•	Review the IPC measures implemented in the affected areas and advise on prevention of healthcare associated infection in healthcare setting within the affected health zones 
•	Review training needs, and based on this assessment, conduct training in IPC for staff at district hospitals, and health facilities according to the review of IPC measures 
•	Report to MOH/WHO international outbreak response team on finding, and activities, and advise on effective and feasible IPC activities in areas affected by the outbreaks 
•	Provide guidance on immediate IPC policies, resources, equipment and training needed for centre, provincial and district level hospitals in order to ensure adequate preparations for response if the outbreak spreads to others health zones 
•	Outline elements of a National Infection and Control strategy in regards to measures pertaining to enhancement of Standard Precautions, and identify activities that can be rapidly implemented 
•	Support the MOH in documenting the outbreak and response activities', 'title': 'Infection Preventionist', 'employment_type': 'Contract'}]}, {'company': {'id': 15094438, 'name': 'Urmia University of Medical Sciences', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQFpTN28oKUpww/company-logo_400_400/0/1569826266472?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=hDmb4Ihy6C6GPnk2XYpaxuaF_LHDi6GWVW2ZFyM5ChM', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/urmia-university-of-medical-sciences/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Urmia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Urmia University of Medical Sciences', 'description': 'Main duties & responsibilities

MSF also support in providing care for patients with advanced HIV in the district hospital, and healthcare for truck drivers and sex workers.

Main duties & responsibilities
•	Participating in the definition of the IPC objectives and in collaboration with the IPC committee, defining, implementing and monitoring the IPC annual plan
•	Setting up regular monitoring mechanisms for IPC activities, analysing the results, identifying priorities and proposing solutions when necessary
•	Establishing, maintaining and improving surveillance systems for health care associated infections in the facility
•	Participating and contributing in the elaboration of the contingency plan and Emergency Preparedness regarding the IPC aspects depending on context and possible scenarios
•	Monitoring and analysing the consumption and the quality of IPC materials and equipment
•	Planning and supervising, with the support of HR department, of the staff in the project under IPC & WatSan department, in order to ensure having the appropriate team in terms of size, capabilities and skills
•	Producing reports with information and recommendations
•	Follows up and consolidates data from different teams', 'title': 'Infection Preventionist', 'employment_type': 'Contract'}]}, {'company': {'id': 5350, 'name': 'World Health Organization', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQEhC1u0R5DRQQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1663777944960?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=j5hFxDNxJXWTH17YwPs98UUMHEDU2aNYw37szFDW218', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/world-health-organization/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Sultanate of Oman', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'World Health Organization', 'description': 'Main duties & responsibilities
•	Conducting the final assessment of  2 government hospitals enrolled in the PSFHI
•	Provide recommendation for quality & patient safety improvement

Duties and Responsibilities
